text: The Canada U-17 men's national soccer team (also known as Canada Under-17s or Canada U-17s) represents Canada in international soccer at this age level. They are overseen by the Canadian Soccer Association, the governing body for soccer in Canada.

Many of Canada's current internationals have played at one or more of these age levels early in their career, often working with the same coaches and teammates throughout their progression into the senior squad.

The team has qualified for nine out of nineteen FIFA U-17 World Cups.  On November 5, 2025, the Canada men's under-17 soccer team achieved its first-ever victory at a FIFA U-17 World Cup by defeating Uganda 2-1 in a match in Doha, Qatar. Elijah Roche scored the equalizer in the 88th minute, and Marius Aiyenero secured the win with a penalty kick in the 98th minute during stoppage time.
The following is a list of match results in the last twelve months, as well as any future matches that have been scheduled.

The following 21 players have been called up for the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup Qatar 2025™, which will be held from November 3 to 27 in Al Rayyan, Qatar. Drawn into Group K, Canada will play Uganda, France, and Chile on November 5, 8, and 11, respectively.Owen Graham-Roache and André Ali-Gayapersad withdrew due to injury on October 29 and were replaced by Marius Aiyenero and Antone Bossenberry respectively,On November 4, Stefan Kapor was replaced by Sasha Cernic due to injury.
Caps and goals as of November 14, 2025, after the match against Ireland.
The following players have been called up for the team within the last twelve months.

The following are 22 players that have been called up for Canada U16 for a UEFA youth development tournament in Poland from 8-18 May, 2025 with matches scheduled against Egypt (0-0) on 13 May, Ireland (0-5) on 15 May and Poland (0-1) on 18 May.
Caps and goals as of May 18, 2025, after the match against Poland.

The following are 23 players that have been called up for Canada U16 for friendly tournament hosted by the Guadeloupe FA against opponents determined by a draw, with double game days on 28 and 29 May 2025, followed by two placement matches on 30 and 31 May.Caps as of May 28, 2025, after the match against Marie-Galante.

The following are 22 players that have been called up for the CONCACAF Boys' Under-15 Championship, set to be played from 2-10 August 2025 in Alajuela, Costa Rica, where Canada will play Costa Rica, Saudi Arabia and USA in the group stage.

The Japan national under-17 football team (Japanese: U-17サッカー日本代表, Hepburn: U-17 sakkā Nihon daihyō) is a national association football youth team of Japan and is controlled by the Japan Football Association. The team were champions in the 1994 and 2006 AFC U-17 Championships, as well as the 2012 AFF U-16 Youth Championship. The year before the FIFA U-17 World Cup, the national team is renamed the Japan national under-16 football team, and the year before that, the national team is renamed the Japan national under-15 football team.
The following U-17 players were called up on 2 September 2025 for the International Youth Soccer in Niigata tournament, held in Niigata, on the same month.
The following U-17 players were called up on 21 August for the Tournoi de Limoges, held on Limoges, France, on September 2025.
The following U-16 players were called up on 24 June for the CFA Peace Cup, held in Shenyang, China on July.
The following U-15 players were called up on 18 August for The Gary Speed Tournament, held on Wales, from 26 to 31 August 2025.
The following players were called up to an U-17 or U-16 squad in the past 12 months.
(Players are listed within position group by order of latest call-up, seniority, and then alphabetically by its surname)
